result.execSummary:
The defendant Susan E. Foster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling, treatment and evaluation per agent.  No contact with J.L.B.  No contact with Wal Mart Stores.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
No good time.  Jail to commence on or before Sept. 19, 2014.  Transfer to LaCrosse County.  EMP approved, per jail rules, per agent.  1 day credit if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 2 and consecutive to any other sentences or commitments.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Susan E. Foster

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.  Proceed to sentencing.

Defendant Susan E. Foster in court with attorney Debra V. O'Rourke.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waives preliminary hearing.  Plea to 2 counts of misd theft.  State files information.  Court goes through information and victim statements.  Defendant & Court review statement.   No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1 & 2:
24 months Probation, concurrent
20 days Sauk County Jail with huber privileges.  No good time.  Jail to commence on or before Sept 19, 2014 at 6:30 p.m.,  Transfer to LaCrosse County, EMP approved, per agent.  1 day credit if revoked. 
Undergo any counseling, treatment and evaluation per agent.
No contact with J.L.B.  No contact with Wal Mart Stores
$2617.31 Restitution J/S
$243.00 costs & $253.00 costs  & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 22, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Attorney Debra V. O'Rourke in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reset.  Bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 15, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 26, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Susan E. Foster in court with attorney Debra V O'Rourke.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney ORourke advises matter is close to resolution.  Request reset.  Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
No contact w/JB or Lake Delton Walmart

Pre-trial conference on May 2, 2014 at 09:15 am.
Return date on May 13, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Susan E. Foster by video from LEC with attorney Debra V. O'Rourke.  Defendant Susan E. Foster in custody.  Sue M. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  State requests cash bond.  Atty O'Rourke responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $1,000.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/J.B. (co-actor) or the Lake Delton Wal-Mart.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 09:15 am.  Return date scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
